value.title: Full Text on Mitch McConnell's Email Explaining Why He Would Vote to Acquit Trump
value.excerpt: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell will vote to acquit former President Donald Trump, he told colleagues on Saturday.

value.title: Republican Rep. Herrera Beutler highlights phone call as riot raged: Trump said to have blamed antifa, enraging McCarthy
value.excerpt: Keving McCarthy, furious, said “Who the f--k do you think you are talking to?” to the then-president, CNN reported.

value.title: Trump attorneys falsely claim he was denied ‘due process’
value.excerpt: Due process is a bedrock protection for anyone facing a loss of “life, liberty or property” — not public office.

value.title: Trump impeachment defense team shows 9-plus minute compilation of Dems using word 'fight'
value.excerpt: House impeachment managers have pointed to Trump’s own words before the Jan. 6 insurrection, when he said supporters would lose the country if they didn't “fight like hell.”

value.title: Trump's defense team calls impeachment trial 'political vengeance'
value.excerpt: Donald Trump's lawyers on Friday began laying out their case for why the former president should be acquitted of inciting last month's deadly riot at the U.S. Capitol, arguing the impeachment trial was an act of "political vengeance" by Democrats.

value.title: Hannity: Democrats never had problem with violent rhetoric towards Trump

value.title: The Daily 202: Trump said the system is ‘rigged.’ Democrats say his acquittal will prove it.
value.excerpt: Donald Trump used popular resentment against elites as political rocket fuel to propel his unlikely 2016 presidential campaign, describing America’s economy and politics as “rigged” against the middle class and railing against a “rigged system” of justice in favor of the powerful.

value.title: Donald Trump’s version of an insanity defense: His critics are insane
value.excerpt: In the summer of 2015, two months after Donald Trump announced he was running for president, a blogger named Esther Goldberg read a Washington Post column by the conservative commentator George F. Will that accused Trump of being phony,

value.title: 'Accomplice' senators who amplified Trump's lies now get a say in his fate
value.excerpt: Republicans Josh Hawley, Ted Cruz and others unabashedly endorsed the former president’s assault on democracy

value.title: Raskin: Trump 'Like the Fire Chief Who Sends the Mob'
value.excerpt: Maryland Rep. Jamie Raskin, the lead impeachment manager, countered arguments made by Donald Trump's attorneys that the former president's words in the lead-up to the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol qualify as protected speech.

value.title: Morning mail: Melbourne cluster grows, Trump's message to insurrectionists, Crown resignations

value.title: Impeachment trial: mob 'believed they were acting on Trump's orders'

value.title: Live updates: Senate must convict Trump to ensure no future president incites insurrection, Democrats say

value.title: Donald Trump Jr. Has 'No Intention' of Running for Office—For Now
value.excerpt: Donald Trump Jr. said he had "no intention" of running for office right now, but did not completely rule out putting himself on the ballot in the future as his father's impeachment trial entered its second day on Wednesday.

value.title: Wall Street Journal: Trump might be acquitted, but won't live down 'disgraceful conduct'
value.excerpt: The Wall Street Journal’s editorial board wrote that while the Senate may acquit former President Trump over the deadly riot at the U.S. Capitol, “he won’t live down his disgraceful conduct.”

value.title: 120 anti-Trump Republicans are in talks to form a center-right 3rd party that would run on 'principled conservatism,' report says
value.excerpt: The group includes former elected officials and people who served in Republican administrations, including Trump's.

value.title: Trump team fires back at Dems, claims they too have used ‘fight like hell’ rhetoric
value.excerpt: The Trump team turned the tables on the Democratic Party’s impeachment managers on Wednesday, after they claimed once again that the former president’s "fight like hell" rhetoric at a Jan. 6 rally in Washington helped spark the riot at the U.

value.title: Adviser Says Donald Trump In 'Great Mood,' Thinks Bruce Castor Made 'Some Good Points'
value.excerpt: "There are a few things that we need to tighten up," Donald Trump's adviser Jason Miller said of Trump's defense team in the Senate impeachment trial.

value.title: 'I don't want to come back:' As Trump trial opens, Democrat recalls daughter's fear during riot

value.title: Video of Capitol riot shown at Trump impeachment trial 'literally took my breath away': Meghan McCain
value.excerpt: Conservative "The View" co-host Meghan McCain said Wednesday that video of last month's Capitol riot that was played at former President Donald Trump's impeachment trial "literally took my breath away".

value.title: New York Assembly advances bill to rename Donald J. Trump State Park
value.excerpt: Democratic legislators have been seeking to rename the park, located about eight miles east of Peekskill, since 2015.

value.title: Home free: Florida town lets Donald Trump keep living at Mar-a-Lago
value.excerpt: Palm Beach town council gave short shrift to a request from neighbors to ban the former president from residing at his resort

value.title: Explicit language in footage shown at Trump's impeachment trial forces TV networks to make a 'tough choice'
value.excerpt: At the start of Donald Trump’s second impeachment trial, TV’s biggest networks aired footage of the US Capitol siege with unusually explicit language.

value.title: Trump tried to block her. Now Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is about to make history.
value.excerpt: The Nigerian economist is set to become the first woman and African national in charge of the World Trade Organization.

value.title: Trial highlights: history lessons, Trump tweets and more
value.excerpt: Donald Trump will stand trial for impeachment after the Senate rejected arguments from the former president’s lawyers that the chamber cannot move forward because he is no longer in office

value.title: Blinken stops short of endorsing Trump recognition of Golan Heights as Israel
value.excerpt: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday stopped short of endorsing the Trump administration's recognition of the occupied Golan Heights as part of Israel, instead noting that the territory was important for Israel's security.

value.title: Trey Gowdy: Democrats chose the 'dumbest' possible impeachment article to bring against Trump
value.excerpt: House Democrats chose the "dumbest of all impeachment articles" to bring against former President Donald Trump last month, Fox News contributor Trey Gowdy told "America Reports" Monday.

value.title: Ex-Parler CEO said he didn't want the platform to work with Trump because the president might have 'bullied' employees into doing what he wanted
value.excerpt: The interview aired after BuzzFeed News reported that Parler had offered Trump a 40% stake in exchange for becoming his go-to social-media platform.

value.title: House managers reject Trump impeachment brief: 'He betrayed the American people' – live
value.excerpt: Polling shows slim majority of Americans want Trump convicted and barred from office

value.title: Donald Trump Jr. slams Super Bowl 2021 commercials as 'woketopia'
value.excerpt: Donald Trump Jr. wasn’t impressed with the Super Bowl 2021 commercial lineup. The son of former president Donald Trump tuned into the big game between the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday but was rolling his eyes at the broadcast almost immediately at the typically sought after ad breaks.
